page.title: 07TRANSPORT IN CUMBERNAULD
page.content: Cumbernauld's transport today will be the same in years to come because it is unique. It was built with the motor car and the{pedestrian}in mind. Firstly it was built to make sure that no pedestrians should be anywhere near the roads. They have their own paths, bridges and underpasses.The road system was built separately with roundabouts and junctions so that there is no need for any traffic lights, which cuts down the number of accidents.There are lots of bus stops near the houses so that nobody has to walk far to catch a bus. There is also a multiple track railway line with a station in the south of Cumbernauld. The bus passes through the station to pick people up and drop them off.There is also an airfield at Wardpark which is mostly used by gliders.
